description: Parasites take an enormous toll on human and veterinary health. But researchers may have found a way for patients with brain disorders and a common brain parasite to become frenemies.
title: A common parasite could deliver drugs to the brain—how scientists are turning Toxoplasma gondii from foe into friend

description: Social networks have revolutionized the way we communicate, stay informed and share moments of our daily lives. We use platforms like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and TikTok to keep in touch with our friends and family, share our experiences, keep informed, and express our opinions.
title: Social media: Disinformation expert offers three safety tips in a time of fake news and dodgy influencers

description: Have you ever liked or shared a social media post about nature? It could have been a photo of a rare orchid or an unusual bird. Or you might share a stunning photo of an "undiscovered" natural place.
title: Liked to death? The social media race for nature photos can trash ecosystems—or trigger rapid extinction

description: Announcing the directive to work "primarily in an approved office," NSW Premier Chris Minns said overseas studies showed people were less productive when working from home.
title: Making workers return to the office might not make them any more productive

description: White men who have personally experienced mistreatment at work, such as bullying, are more likely to realize that their organization does not always operate fairly. And that makes them more likely to recognize and report race and gender bias against their co-workers, I found in a recent study.
title: White men who have been mistreated at work are more likely to notice and report harassment

description: The discovery of a tiny arm bone suggests that an ancient human dubbed "hobbits" only shrank down to their diminutive size after they arrived on an Indonesian island a million years ago, scientists said on Tuesday.
title: Discovery of tiny bone sheds light on mysterious 'hobbit' humans

description: New results from the first archaeological fieldwork conducted in space show the International Space Station is a rich cultural landscape where crew create their own "gravity" to replace Earth's, and adapt module spaces to suit their needs.
title: Archaeologists conduct first 'space excavation' on ISS and discover surprising quirks of zero-G life

description: This week's headlines include the extended sleepover for astronauts in the SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule, insight into our imitative behaviors, and the Olympic form of mice.
title: Saturday Citations: A rare misstep for Boeing; mouse jocks and calorie restriction; human brains in sync

description: With the first launch of Blue Origin's massive New Glenn rocket still in the works before the end of the year, Jeff Bezos' company got to work testing out its recovery operations with the huge crane parked at Port Canaveral on August 8.
title: Blue Origin tests out New Glenn rocket recovery crane at Port Canaveral

description: Air pollution caused by "ultrafine particles," emitted by automobiles and industrial activity, has been linked to 1,100 deaths a year in Montreal and Toronto, according to new Canadian research.
title: Ultrafine particles linked to deaths: Canada study

description: An infographic of a rat with a preposterously large penis. Another showing human legs with way too many bones. An introduction that starts: "Certainly, here is a possible introduction for your topic".
title: Flood of 'junk': How AI is changing scientific publishing

description: Two astronauts stranded in space may sound like the start to a big-screen science thriller, but the Boeing Starliner mission is no work of Hollywood fiction.
title: Meet the two Boeing mission astronauts stuck aboard the ISS

description: Sicilian lemon producer Rosario Cognata is furious: his fruit is withering due to the drought, while just a few kilometers away rainwater is being dumped into the sea.
title: In drought-hit Sicily, rainwater is dumped in the sea
